tweets.text:
I've put it off long enough. This is my @vgr thread.

One ❤️ gets you a description of one of my brain's recurring pieces of imagery.
@vgr With a long needle, you sew thin wires under the skin of your left fore-arm, then connect them to a car battery. Your skin tingles & your hairs stand on end as you become a living solenoid.

@vgr As you raise your arms above your head. 
A plateau, unblemished by life, rises from the ocean.

@vgr You are a fetus contained within a shining orb of light.
All is peace.

@vgr You rest on marble stairs, head sunk forward. 
People pass you on either side, oblivious to your presence.
Suddenly, wings burst forth from your back.
You flex your shoulder blades as they unfurl, keenly aware of every sensation in your muscles.

@vgr You make a diagonal chopping motion with your arm.
Inertia takes hold and your hand continue moving away from you to infinity.

@vgr On my chin there is a pearl.
Unlike the rest of my stubble, it is a point of smooth comfort.
You begin to melt, sloughing away into a thick fluid. You feel the pull of the moon & find yourself sloshing back and forth in a slow tide.

You stare at your reflection in the mirror.
A spark shines in your eyes.
You wonder if it's a trick or the light, but it grows.
Soon, cool green flames are burning in your sockets, casting a strange glow over your visage.

You pick at your fingernail, something catches, & then you peel the nail away from the bed. There is no pain. No sensation at all.

You see a circuit board where the end of your finger once was.

You concentrate on your breathing & feel a touch of warmth.
Why are your hands on fire?

There's a storm on the horizon.
Electricity in the air & in your veins.
You are pure power.
Liquid energy.
It's calling you to return to the sky.

The tower pulses red on the horizon.
It's watching you.
You smear your mind across the cosmic void, like butter over toast.
A knot in your muscle sprouts a small sapling. To it, you're little more than compost.
The itching won't stop. You tear at your skin until thin filaments of black glass sprout from your wrists & neck.
As you lay in bed, your sheets morph into gears whose clenching teeth grind your legs into a bloody pulp.

Someone at the gym complements you on your pump, "You are so vascular.". 

Your bulging veins continue to grow to the thickness of ropes. Kudzu-like strands puppeteer your limbs through another set.
Your freckles move when nobody is looking.
You stand up abruptly. That's all it takes. Your organs begin to crumble to dust.

"Opposites are just a part of a continuum.", you intone.

With the flourish of a sorcerer, you transmute hate into love.
Tattoos move as shadows across your skin, always staying in the right spot to flaunt your most flattering features.

You smell an strange scent, earthy with hints of fresh-cut timber. You cannot find its source. 

Nobody else notices it, or at least they pretend not to.

You run toward the ledge, prepared to leap off.

Suddenly, it's a sunny summer day & you're jumping from a short, wooden dock into a pond. The splash breaks up the reflection of the distant mountains.
The lion in your gut roars with delight as you toss scraps down your gullet.

As you wink, a third eye opens.
You never seem to lose depth perception.
You stand on a precipice. A lion-monster prowls below you, waiting for you to slip so that it can devour you.
Side-note: As a child, this was a regular fever dream of mine.
